ConfigurationMgrIf
public class ConfigurationMgr
extends BaseMgr
implements ConfigurationMgrIf

Manages all business logic relevant to the management of configurations within the system

                                           KKException

Returns an array of Configuration objects containing all configurations that have been defined in the system and that have been defined to be returned via the API.

getConfigurations

public KKConfiguration[] getConfigurations(boolean checkReturnByApi)
                                    throws org.apache.torque.TorqueException,
                                           com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException,
                                           KKException
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationMgrIf
Returns an array of Configuration objects containing all configurations that have been defined in the system. This returns ALL configuration objects even if they have not been defined to be returned via the API.

Specified by:
getConfigurations in interface ConfigurationMgrIf
Parameters:
checkReturnByApi - if true a check is made on whether each configuration parameter can be returned by the API. Only those configuration parameters allowed to be returned by the API are returned.

if false, no check is performed and all configuration parameters are returned.

Returns:
An array of Configuration objects.
Throws:
org.apache.torque.TorqueException
com.workingdogs.village.DataSetException
KKException

getConfigData

public ConfigDataIf[] getConfigData(java.lang.String sessionId,
                                    java.lang.String key)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationMgrIf
Returns the ConfigData items with the specified key or all ConfigData items if the key is null. The session is checked to ensure it is valid and hasn't expired.

Specified by:
getConfigData in interface ConfigurationMgrIf
Parameters:
sessionId - Session Id of the customer.
key - Only return the ConfigData items with this key
Returns:
Returns an array of ConfigData items with the specified key or all ConfigData items if the key is null ordered by date added
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getConfigData

public ConfigDataIf[] getConfigData(java.lang.String key)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationMgrIf
Returns the ConfigData items with the specified key or all ConfigData items if the key is null. No session check is carried out with this version.

Specified by:
getConfigData in interface ConfigurationMgrIf
Parameters:
key - Only return the ConfigData items with this key (if null all ConfigData items are returned)
Returns:
Returns an array of ConfigData items with the specified key or all ConfigData items if the key is null ordered by date added
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

editConfiguration

@Deprecated
public void editConfiguration(java.lang.String key,
                                         java.lang.String value)
                       throws KKException
Deprecated. From version 6.3.0.0 you should use the Administration APIs (KKAdminIf) instead.

This API has been deprecated and throws a KKException in all cases. Configuration values will no longer be modified using this call.

Previously this call allowed the edit of an existing configuration parameter. It threw an exception if the configuration didn't exist.

Specified by:
editConfiguration in interface ConfigurationMgrIf
Parameters:
key - key whose value will be set
value - value to set
Throws:
KKException

checkIfReturnable

protected boolean checkIfReturnable(java.lang.String key)
                             throws KKException
Check to see if we can return this configuration parameter. We look up the "ReturnByApi" attribute for the configuration key. If it's set to 1 (true) we can return the configuration parameter. If set to 0 (false) we cannot and throw a KKException. If there is no configuration parameter for the specified key we log the probably error and return true.

Parameters:
key -
Returns:
true if the configuration parameter can be returned by the API
Throws:
KKException - if the configuration parameter cannot be returned by the API

                    throws java.lang.Exception
Refresh the configuration of the Configuration manager

refreshConfigs in interface ConfigurationMgrIf
